faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our MTB trips.

guideService.q: What does the guide service include?
guideService.a: The guide package includes daily briefing and route planning based on your level, accompanied rides, basic mechanical support, local recommendations and trip logistics coordination.

level.q: What level do I need to participate?
level.a: We have routes for intermediate and advanced levels. It's important to know how to handle your bike on technical trails. If you have doubts about your level, contact us and we'll advise you.

duration.q: How many days does a typical trip last?
duration.a: The most common trips are 3-4 days of riding, but we can organize anything from weekend getaways to full weeks.

verified.a: These are accommodations we have personally visited that meet specific requirements for MTB groups: ample parking, bike storage area, good location relative to trails, etc.

ownAccommodation.q: Can I book my own accommodation?
ownAccommodation.a: Of course! You can book on Airbnb or Booking and then hire just the guide and extras from us. We have a specific form for this.

availability.a: Houses are shown as "available upon confirmation". After your request, we verify availability and confirm within 24h.

managementFee.a: It's a fee that covers trip planning, coordination with transport and service providers, change management, and support throughout your stay.

payments.a: When booking, you pay MTB Experience for the guide service and management fee. If the accommodation is from our inventory, you also pay through us. Partner services (transfers, shuttles) can be paid directly to them or through us depending on the case.

cancellation.a: Free cancellation up to 30 days before. Between 30-14 days, 50% retention. Less than 14 days, no refund. Check the full terms in our cancellation policy.

bike.q: Do I need to bring my own bike?
bike.a: We recommend bringing your own bike, but we have rental partners for eMTB and DH bikes if you prefer not to transport it.

transport.a: Yes, we work with transport partners who can pick you up from Málaga, Granada or Seville airports.

shuttle.a: Yes, depending on the zone we can arrange shuttles to maximize descending. This is added as an extra in the configurator.

rights.content: You have the right to access, rectify, delete, limit and object to the processing of your data, as well as to data portability. To exercise these rights, contact us at info@mtbexperience.com

cookies.content: We use technical and analytical cookies. You can configure your browser to reject them, although some functionalities may be affected.

summary.title: Summary
summary.over30: +30 days before: Free cancellation, full refund

over30.title: More than 30 days before the start date
over30.content: 100% refund of the amount paid, without penalty.

between.title: Between 30 and 14 days before the start date
between.content: 50% retention of the total amount. The remaining 50% will be refunded.

under14.title: Less than 14 days before the start date
under14.content: No refund will be made. The amount paid will be forfeited in full.

modifications.title: 2. Booking modifications
modifications.content1: Date modifications are subject to availability and may incur additional costs if there is a seasonal price difference.
modifications.content2: Minor changes (number of participants, extras) can be made up to 7 days before at no cost, subject to availability.

byUs.title: 3. Cancellations by MTB Experience
byUs.intro: In the event that MTB Experience must cancel the trip for justified reasons (extreme weather conditions, force majeure, etc.), we will offer:
byUs.option1: Date change at no additional cost, or
byUs.option2: Full refund of the amount paid

thirdParty.title: 4. Third-party services
thirdParty.content: Services provided by third parties (external accommodation, transport, etc.) may have their own cancellation policies. Please consult the specific conditions of each provider.

trailbuilders.title: Trailbuilders: Building Community
trailbuilders.subtitle: Discover the important work of maintaining and building the trails we love

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Trails don't maintain themselves. Behind every amazing trail is a group of dedicated volunteers who work tirelessly to maintain, repair, and improve the routes we enjoy. Trailbuilders are the heart of our MTB community.
mission.importance: Without trail building and maintenance work, our favorite routes would disappear under erosion, vegetation, and neglect. Every hour of volunteer work helps preserve these natural spaces for future generations of riders.

clearing.title: Vegetation Clearing
clearing.description: We clear and maintain trails free of brush and obstacles.

drainage.title: Drainage & Channeling
drainage.description: We build water channels to prevent terrain erosion.

signage.title: Signage
signage.description: We install and maintain signs for rider safety.

erosion.title: Erosion Control
erosion.description: We reinforce vulnerable areas to preserve trail integrity.

features.title: Feature Building
features.description: We design and build jumps, berms, and technical elements.

cleanup.title: Trash Cleanup
cleanup.description: We keep trails and forests free of waste.

giveBack.title: Give Back to the Community
giveBack.description: Want to contribute during your trip? Add a Give Back Day to your MTB experience and join a community work day with local Trailbuilders.
giveBack.included: Includes tools, expert guide, and lunch

benefits.title: What you get:
benefits.item3: Satisfaction of giving back to the trails
